page.title: 15Education in Windsor
page.content: { What is the best age to change {schools?}Nobody around this area seems to know. In Windsor we change at 9 and 13, but 3 miles away in Slough, it happens at 8 and 12. In Maidenhead, pupils change schools at 11. This all happens in the same county. More confusing still, we had a boys' and a girls' grammar school in Windsor until 10 years ago. Now all schools are comprehensive. In Slough, there are still grammar schools and secondary modern schools. Some parents who live in Slough want their child to come to Windsor whilst some Windsor parents prefer Slough. Some schools are closing due to the fall in the birthrate. In 1981 there were 5509 pupils in Windsor schools and by 1991 there will be only 4512.
